title: How to deal with High Ping?
body: Hello everyone, recently I've been getting around 500 ping and its been VERY frustrating since when I lag, I tilt. Any tips on how too deal with such an annoyance?

replies.body: Those things dont lag me, but what does is my brother downloading steam games and optus doing there stuff.

Don't play when your brother is downloading stuff, or ask him to download overnight or when you're not playing. If you already know that's why you're lagging it shouldn't take a rocket scientist to work out how to fix it.
I did, he starts when its 20-30 minutes into a match.

> Those things dont lag me, but what does is my brother downloading steam games and optus doing there stuff.

skype will actually lag you. in advanced settings somewhere you can uncheck the port option. fixed my lag after a reset
I tried that but I still got tons of ping lol.

You can't. If everyone is experiencing it than Rito will have something to say, but if there is no widespread reports than it is just you and you can basically suffer.

Anything over 250 ping is unplayable in online games, even at around 200 whilst you can play, it gets increasingly frustrating that on your screen things work different to the server and makes it not fun, at 500 I am surprised you even bother, you will always be around half a second slower.

Firstly I would be sticking to bots, at least that way you are still guaranteed a win and will not disadvantage anyone.

Secondly I would be looking at trouble shooting everything, turn of ALL other programs that use bandwidth, and I mean all of them. Simply go into your Task Manager and end every task there is that uses the internet.

Next you will want to go into your router settings and setup QoL, force everyone else but you own rig to have no access, now try again. If it still pings high, you have problems, if not, you turn everything back on one at a time and test your own custom games with nothing but you and maybe a bot, this will allow you to quit instantly without penalty, turn some more programs back on and try again.

I would be turning off all your programs and other computers and seeing what happens, if you get high ping than at least you know it is one of the other computers on the network. If you don't get high ping, it would most likely point to something on your own computer that is making the lag high.
